abstract: A case of a 34 year old female with clinical and histological confirmed eosinophilic granuloma causing osteolytic lesions of the mandible and skull and diabetes insipidus. Dyspnea, cough, exercise intolerance with ventilatory disturbances and radiological evidence of interstitial lung disease were believed to be in the course of eosinophilic granuloma. The patient refused lung biopsy and BAL. After starting therapy with corticosteroids all respiratory symptoms improved.
title: [Interstitial lung disease in Langerhans-cell granulomatosis in a 34-year-old woman].
